subject: Re: [junit] Enhancement Request: Assert.fail(Exception e) could b e useful.
msgSnippet: ... I used to think this way, too. I found that after a while I didn t care whether I saw F or E : I treated them the same way, so that s why I stopped
messageBody:
Stoneham, John G. wrote:

> I would agree. I spend a lot of time in my unit tests writing the structure:
>
> public void testWhatever() {
> setup_stuff_here();
> more_setup_stuff_here();
> try {
> method_under_test();
> } catch(Exception e) {
> fail(e.getMessage());
> }
> }
>
> because an error indicates an exception thrown by functionality NOT under
> test. An exception thrown by functionality that IS under test is properly
> reported as a failure (the implicit assertion is that there will be no
> exception thrown).

I used to think this way, too. I found that after a while I didn't care
whether I saw "F" or "E": I treated them the same way, so that's why I
stopped using the above pattern.

Do you /really/ troubleshoot differently based on whether you see F or E?
--
J. B. Rainsberger,
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com :: +1 416 791-8603
Let's write software that people understand
